item.title: Dinkum: Best Ways To Make Money Fast
item.description:
Summary

  • Bug catching: Fast money with rare bugs
  • Hunting: Earn Dinks with animal meat
  • Deep mining: Uncover gems for high rewards

In the world of Dinkum , where players build their lives on a charming outback-inspired island, earning Dinks quickly can be the difference between a modest homestead and a thriving paradise.

The game offers a wide range of activities, from farming and fishing to mining and crafting, and each provides an opportunity to stack up Dinks rapidly. For Dinkum players looking to build up their fortune and develop their town at a quicker rate, several tried-and-true strategies consistently prove profitable.

7 Bug Catching

Sell crawling critters for Dinks

  • Requirements: Bug Net

One of the most accessible and reliable ways to make money fast in Dinkum is through bug catching. Players can begin catching bugs early in the game with a simple bug net. While the activity is easy to pick up, it becomes a guaranteed money maker when players know where and when to look.

Insects such as the blue moon butterfly, scarlet jezebel, and harlequin butterfly spawn frequently in certain seasons and locations, particularly around grassy or forested areas. Selling a stack of rare bugs to John can result in several thousand Dinks in just one outing, making bug catching one of the fastest ways to build early-game funds.

6 Hunting

Track and Fight Predators

  • Requirements: Weapon and Hunting License

Hunting wild animals can be a fun and satisfying way to earn Dinks. Creatures like crocos, jackaroos, and bush devils drop valuable meat and sometimes rare items. Croco meat, in particular, sells for a good amount when cooked. As players unlock stronger weapons, they can take down tougher enemies faster and earn more rewards.

Animal trapping is even better, as captured animals can be sent to the Animal Research Centre for a hefty payout. While hunting does bring in decent money, it requires stamina, combat skill, and preparation, making it slightly less efficient than other methods unless players consistently target high-value creatures.

5 Fishing

Fish in Rivers and the Ocean

  • Requirements: Fishing Rod and Fishing License

Fishing offers a consistent and moderate income. With just a fishing rod, players can explore rivers and coastal waters for valuable species like barramundi and blue spot flathead. Fish can be caught year-round, though certain types are seasonal and bring in more Dinks.

Fishing requires patience, but it has low setup costs and doesn’t rely heavily on infrastructure. It’s a peaceful and reliable way to gather funds, particularly when players identify good fishing spots and optimize their routes. Still, the income from fishing tends to plateau, which places it in the middle of the list.

4 Crafting

Make Furniture and Other Useful Items

  • Requirements: Crafting Table and Crafting Recipes

Once players access crafting stations and recipes, item production becomes indispensable. Crafting items like torches, traps, furniture, or bee houses can generate substantial returns if materials are abundant. Bee houses, for example, create honey over time without any further effort, providing a passive income stream.

Players can also craft and sell cooking stations, fences, and tools for solid returns. The downside is that crafting often requires an upfront investment in raw materials and time. For players who enjoy organizing resources and producing in bulk, crafting offers a scalable method for earning money.

3 Farming and Crops

Grow and Sell Crops

  • Requirements: Watering Can, Hoe, Crop Seeds, and Farming License

Farming requires more investment than other methods, but has the best long-term income rate. Once Rayne settles in and provides seeds, players can grow crops like sugarcane, wheat, pumpkins, and watermelons. The real money comes from processing these crops.

Sugarcane turned into sugar, and wheat milled into flour sells for far more than its base crop value. With sprinklers and fenced fields, players can scale up their farms and reduce daily maintenance. Though slower to start, farming eventually becomes one of Dinkum's most stable and high-yield income sources .

2 Selling Cooked Food

Roast Meat, Vegetables, and Fruit

  • Requirements: Campfire (or Grill) and Fresh Ingredients

Cooking turns foraged goods, hunted meat, and farmed produce into high-value meals. Recipes like pavlova, fruit salad, and meat dishes can be sold for several thousand Dinks each. Since cooking stacks bonuses and increases item value, it significantly boosts profits from otherwise modest ingredients.

Players can forage bush limes, bananas, and coconuts or rely on their farms to keep their kitchens stocked. Cooking is especially useful when players combine it with other activities, turning excess fish or crops into meals rather than selling them raw. With the right recipes, cooked meals consistently outperform most other single-item sales.

1 Mining Gems and Ore

Dig Up Ores and Rare Gemstones

  • Requirements: Pickaxe, Shovel, Mining License, and Deep Mining License

At the top of the list is deep mining, which is by far the most lucrative way to make money fast. Players can explore the underground for high-value resources after unlocking the deep mine license and preparing the right tools. While ores and bars are profitable on their own, it’s the discovery of rubies and opals that turns a single mining trip into a major payday.

Depending on their size, rubies can be valued at over 40,000 Dinks, and the mine often yields more than one per visit. Players can use the shipping elevator to send these straight to the surface for sale. Despite the danger and preparation required, deep mining offers the biggest rewards quickly.

item.title: Blue Prince: Solarium Puzzle Walkthrough
item.description:
Blue Prince has a slew of little puzzle boxes all over the house, each with a different collection of colorful blocks. In order to win, you need to figure out what all those different colored blocks do and how to move them around to get them in the right places.

In the Solarium, you will find one of these Mora Jai boxes, and this one is a Nuance puzzle box. This means you will need to get green in each of the four corners before you can get it open.

How to Solve the Solarium Mora Jai Puzzle Box in Blue Prince

Like all the other Mora Jai boxes in Blue Prince , the Solarium box has different colors in each of the nine squares. Each color moves differently than the other colors, and there are three in this box. There are two gray boxes, several green boxes, and three yellow boxes.

  • Green boxes move to the opposing block when clicked.
    • Green boxes in slot 1 will exchange places with 9 and vice versa.
    • If a green box in slot 7 will change places with box 3 and vice versa.
    • 2 and 8 greens will also change places with each other.
    • 4 and 6 are also considered opposites.
    • If slot 5 is green, it will stay where it is when clicked.

  • Yellow boxes move up one when clicked.
  • Gray boxes do nothing.

Given all of these rules, you need to move the yellows to the middle in the right and left column. Here are the order you need to click the boxes in to get this to happen. It is not the only way to do this one, but it is an easy way to make sure you beat the box in the Solarium floorplan in Blue Prince .

Inside the box will be an allowance token which raises your daily Blue Prince allowance. After this box is completed, it will no longer appear in the Solarium after you end the day.

How to Get the Solarium in Blue Prince

The Solarium is one of the many floorplans that can appear in the Drafting Studio, a floorplan that allows you to add new rooms to your drafting pool permanently and has a B lue Prince safe inside it.. Every time you draft the Drafting Studio, you will be able to choose one of three rooms, and it will be immediately part of the drafting pool. Add the Solarium, and it will show as a Standard, Dead End room that raises your chances of drafting rarer rooms.

10 Images

item.title: 8 Fantasy Games With The Best Exploration, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Metroidvanias like Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow offer vast worlds for exploration & discovery.
  • Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot allows fans to explore Earth & Namek in an open-world RPG setting.
  • Pokemon Legends: Arceus provides a free-form Pokemon game with open-world exploration.

It's not necessarily the goal of every fantasy game , but developers typically want to immerse players in the worlds that they create. It doesn't matter if it's an original world or if it's one adapted from another property, like a movie or an anime. Sometimes, exploring a known world in video game form is more mesmerizing since that interactivity is not a part of other media available.

Between classic consoles and current ones, there are many great fantasy worlds with interesting virtual landscapes to explore . Not all of them are open-world games either, as some of the smallest landscapes hold some of the greatest secrets. This list will rank some of these games based on how players can interact with their worlds and their overall quality.

8 Castlevania: Dawn Of Sorrow

Don’t Mess With A Metroidvania

Your comment has not been saved

Castlevania: Dawn Of Sorrow
6.0 /10
Released
October 4, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Metroidvanias are all about exploration and discovery, and a great one to represent the genre as a whole is Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow . The castle and its accompanying grounds are big, at least by 2D standards. There’s a lot to do, too, from finding and buying gear to copying monster abilities, which adds to that freeing feeling of discovery.

It’s one of the easier Castlevania games to get into, and it originally debuted on the DS, but t itoday is available on multiple consoles via the Castlevania Dominus Collection .

7 Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot

Goku’s Journey

Your comment has not been saved

Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot
8.0 /10
Released
January 16, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is the perfect game for longtime fans of the series. It starts during the Saiyan arc in the anime and ends during the Buu arc, plus there were DLC episodes from future series added later on. The game mostly focuses on Goku and his quest to become the strongest, but in an open-world action RPG format.

It allows fans to explore this series’ version of Earth, along with other worlds like Namek, like no other game has done before. While abridged in some instances, it’s a quality adaptation of the source material and has plenty of Easter Eggs for eagle-eyed players and anime fans alike.

6 Pokemon Legends: Arceus

A Free-Form Pokemon Game

Your comment has not been saved

Pokemon Legends: Arceus
9 /10
12
7.2 /10
Released
January 28, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
12
7.2 /10

ESRB
E for Everyone: Mild Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Pokemon Legends: Arceus is a strange spinoff, but it's also the first Pokemon game that allows players to explore an open world where they can capture Pokemon freely without having to battle every time. It's a concept that fans had been dreaming of ever since the Pokemon series debuted in Japan in 1996.

Pokemon Legends: Arceus is also a fun throwback, as it takes place in the past, unlike other games in the series, and it's an isekai to boot. While there is;t much to do besides capturing Pokemon, it's still a fun game to explore the world and find new creatures, just like a Pokemon game should be.

5 Kingdom Hearts 3

Expansive Disney Worlds Like Never Before

Your comment has not been saved

Kingdom Hearts 3
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
January 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
9.0 /10

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Kingdom Hearts 3 offers the most diverse set of Disney planets in the series, from animated films like Tangled to live-action features like Pirates of the Caribbean . While each planet ian't an open-world area, they are bigger than what's featured in previous entries.

Like Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot , Kingdom Hearts 3 gave Disney fans a chance to dive into their favorite movies and experience them like they were new again. Besides the exploration aspects, it also boasts a more fully-featured combat system that always manages to keep things interesting, like Sora’s Keyblade transformations.

4 Ni No Kuni: Wrath Of The White Witch

Studio Ghibli Comes To Life

Your comment has not been saved

Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch
9.5 /10
Released
January 22, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Alcohol and Tobacco Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling
Powered by

Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch is a collaboration between Bandai Namco, Level-5, and Studio Ghibli. While the famous anime film company had worked on games before this, Ni no Kuni was a new experience that saw them work with a lot more influence. From top to bottom, it feels like a Ghibli movie, from the character designs and music to the heartfelt narrative, and that was enough to get players excited to explore every inch of content in the game.

The gameplay is similar to the Pokemon games of the era and offers players a world map to explore with tons of hidden secrets. It's a throwback to the SNES and PS1 days and the heights of retro RPGs, which is when many fans fell in love with the genre.

3 Hogwarts Legacy

Harry Potter On A Magical Scale

Your comment has not been saved

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
66
8.8 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
66

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Hogwarts Legacy highlights a world that players can personally experience for the first time in a video game. While there were many Harry Potter games before this, Hogwarts Legacy is the first original story, and lets players create their own Hogwarts student and attend the school throughout the year.

The grounds are vast, with lots of secrets and nods to the series to uncover. Beyond Hogwarts is a giant world just waiting to be discovered, be it on foot or on a broomstick, which is exactly what fans wanted for years, and hopefully, they can get a sequel one day as well.

2 Final Fantasy 9

A World Where Chocobos Matter

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 9
14
9.6 /10
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Final Fantasy 9 is a throwback to the beginnings of the series and features many returning elements, such as Crystals, bosses, and explorable areas. What makes it stand out beyond the nods to the series' past is that the world feels more dense and lived in when compared to other games, saided by the numerous races that all exist within each kingdom.

What truly makes the game fun to explore, though, is the Chocobo Hot and Cold mini-game. Players can use tablets to figure out areas in the world to take their Chocobo where they can find treasure chests, This is an involved process. It adds way more flavor to the world, and fans might argue that this is one of the best mini-games in the series because of this interaction.

1 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Still The King

Your comment has not been saved

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
40
9.1 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
10 /10
40
9.1 /10

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is going to be a hard game to top for the series, and for open-world games as a whole. There’s no way to recapture just how deeply thrilling it is to start exploring this version of Hyrule on the Switch.

The game and console experiences are joined at the hip, which almost single-handedly made 2017 a banner year for video games. Sure, it's another open-world game, but it adds so much to the genre, like being able to safely glide from great heights or the ability to climb nearly every surface, which opens up nearly endless exploration possibilities. To call The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild groundbreaking would be an understatement.

item.title: Upcoming Pokemon TCG Set Reveals New Cards
item.description:
Summary

  • Black Bolt & White Flare will feature Unova Pokemon, with new rarities like AR & BWR cards.
  • Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus cards will be released in the upcoming Pokemon TCG sets.
  • The next sets after Black Bolt & White Flare will focus on Mega Evolutions and feature over 126 cards.

Pokemon TCG has revealed Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus cards that will soon be available. They will be part of Black Bolt and White Flare, two sets to be released as the seventh Pokemon TCG expansion of the Scarlet and Violet era.

Black Bolt and White Flare will focus on Unova, featuring cards of the 156 Pokemon introduced by Gen 5. The set will be released exclusively in Japan, and all the cards will have secret variants of tier Art Rare (AR) or higher. Black Bolt and White Flare will also add a new rarity called BWR (BW Rare), a type of Holofoil card with an elaborate pattern and an illustration of a Pokemon against a unique background color. Giving a further preview of what to expect from the upcoming set, new cards have been shown.

Poke Beach revealed the Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus cards from the Black Bolt and White Flare sets. The trio of Legendary Pokemon from Unova got regular cards with illustrations by Nisota Niso (Tornadus), hncl (Thundurus), and Kasumasa Yasukuni (Landorus). While Thundurus and Landorus will be available in Black Bolt, Pokemon fans will find the Tornadus card in White Flare. The Pokemon also received Art Rare variants with artwork created by Kouki Saitou (Tornadus), Anesaki Dynamic (Thundurus), and Sie Nanahara (Landorous). The AR cards will have the same availability, with Thundurus appearing in White Flare, and Landorus and Tornadus in Black Bolt.

Upcoming Pokemon TCG Set Will Have Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus Cards

Black Bolt and White Flare will be released on June 6, featuring over 172 cards for fans to collect. Each booster box will come with 20 packs, which will come in two variants: the regular pack, with seven cards and two guaranteed to be Holofoil, and the deluxe, with 35 cards and one guaranteed to be AR rarity or better. That will be the next release after The Glory of Team Rocket, the Pokemon TCG set that introduced new cards focused on the franchise's iconic villains that hit the shelves in Japan on April 18.

Following the release of Black Bolt and White Flare, the next Pokemon TCG set to come out in Japan will focus on Mega Evolutions. Named Mega Brave and Mega Symphonia, the expansions will also be released as a single set that will add more than 126 cards. Meanwhile, players in the West are preparing for the release of the Destined Rivals expansion, which will arrive on May 30 with more than 240 new cards to collect.

item.title: Clair Obscur Expedition 33: Best Monoco Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Monoco in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 stands out with unique shapeshifting Nevron skills and Bestial Wheel mechanics, with some weapons significantly boosting his potential.
  • Sidaro and Nusaro are excellent weapons for enhancing Monoco's skill damage, unlocking powerful perks when upgraded.
  • Certain weapons like Joyaro allow Monoco to start in Almighty Mask, delivering massive damage boosts from turn one, making it one of the best weapons for him.

Among all the playable characters in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , Monoco is undoubtedly the most unique, and not just because he's the only Gestral in the party. Unlike other characters, players can't choose which skills to unlock when leveling him up and must search for Nevron feet in the world to shapeshift into them and use their powerful skills. On top of that, Monoco has a unique Bestial Wheel mechanic that boosts various Nevron skills depending on their mask alignment (Agile, Caster, Balanced, Heavy, or Almighty).

Compared to other characters, Monoco has the fewest unique weapons that players can find and upgrade in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , with strong perks unlocking at Levels 4, 10, and 20, but each weapon brings something new and powerful to the table. While some weapons focused solely on one specific Mask type have limited potential, locking players into just a fraction of what Monoco is capable of, others, especially those that grant bonuses for reaching and capitalizing on the Almighty Mask (boosts all skills), are among the best and strongest options for this powerful Gestral. Below, we'll rank the best weapons for Monoco in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 .

7 Ballaro

For Those Who Fight Alongside

  • Scaling: Defense & Agility
  • Element: Light

Level 4

Reverse Bestial Wheel Order

Level 10

Using an Upgraded Skill (with a proper Mask active) gives 1 AP to all other allies

Level 20

Almighty Mask gives 2 AP to all allies

Aside from Monoco weapons focused on one specific Mask type that limits their utility, such as Boucharo, Chromaro, Grandaro, and Monocaro, Ballaro is a somewhat ‘okay’ weapon for Monoco, yet it shouldn't be the main focus for players unless they have no stronger option. The reason Ballaro ranks last here is that it doesn't directly boost any of Monoco's abilities, instead serving as a potent tool to enhance other party members in the squad, rendering Monoco a supporter rather than the fierce fighter this Gestral naturally is.

Ballaro's reverse Bestial Wheel order perk doesn't change things drastically, while the additional AP (action points) for all allies might sound appealing, as playing any skill in the Almighty Mask grants three AP to everyone in the party. This allows players to use powerful skills with other members more often but doesn't enhance their damage in any way. Additionally, Ballaro's base power is notably weaker compared to Monoco's other armaments.

6 Urnaro

Break Isn't Something to Overlook

  • Scaling: Vitality & Luck
  • Element: Earth

Level 4

Switch to Almighty Mask on Breaking an enemy

Level 10

Almighty Mask gives 2 AP to all allies

Level 20

50% increased Break damage

Urnaro offers a way to reach the Almighty Mask for Monoco more often while also significantly increasing Break damage dealt to enemies. To make the most of this weapon in Expedition 33 , players should focus on Heavy Mask skills, many of which deal Break damage, and equip Break Pictos and Luminas to Monoco. With the right setup, this fierce Gestral becomes one of the best at Breaking enemies, allowing him to use the Almighty Mask more frequently with Urnaro — and, in many cases, deal substantial damage to already stunned enemies.

Additionally, reaching the Almighty Mask with Urnaro grants two AP to all allies, which is always good to have. The only downside of Urnaro is that it doesn't provide any damage boost to Monoco's attacks and skills, which somewhat limits its combat potential.

5 Fragaro

Gestrals Can Be Really Good at Shooting

  • Scaling: Defense & Luck
  • Element: Lightning

Level 4

Free Aim shots spin the Bestial Wheel to a random value

Level 10

Free Aim shots deal 100% more damage with all Masks except Almighty

Level 20

100% Critical Chance while in Almighty Mask

Right off the bat, Fragaro offers some of the highest Power values among Monoco's weapons, which may be enough for players aiming to create a high-damage build in Clair Obscure: Expedition 33 . However, Fragaro isn't primarily a melee weapon — it's a tool to enhance Monoco's shooting capabilities. Not only does this weapon spin the Bestial Wheel with Free Aim shots, allowing players to reach the Almighty Mask more often, but shots also deal double damage unless players reach their destination with this revolver roulette.

When in Almighty, Monoco gains a 100% Critical Hit Chance, eliminating the need to equip critical Pictos and Luminas, freeing up slots for Free Aim shots enhancements, and allowing players to focus on attributes like Agility for extra Speed and more frequent turns. Overall, Fragaro isn't groundbreaking but is a very fun Monoco weapon to use.

4 Nusaro

Unserious Looks for Some Serious Results

  • Scaling: Vitality & Agility
  • Element : Dark

Level 4

Parries increase the Bestial Wheel by 1, taking damage resets the Bestial Wheel

Level 10

Upgraded Skills deal 30% more damage

Level 20

+1 AP on Mask change

Despite this weapon's weird looks (though some players might enjoy wielding a frying pan in combat), Nusaro is among the best and strongest weapon choices for Monoco in Expedition 33 . This stems from Nusaro's exceptionally high raw Power output on its own, as well as its Level 10 perk, which directly boosts upgraded skills by 30% without any prerequisites for this decent bonus.

Nusaro's other perks are equally strong, as each Mask change grants Monoco an extra action point. While somewhat parry-demanding to keep the Bestial Wheel predictable, Level 4 perk isn't the most defining feature Nusaro offers, so players who struggle with parrying needn't worry too much — they still get a highly effective weapon.

3 Sidaro

Play by the Rules and Be Rewarded Generously

  • Scaling: Might & Luck
  • Element: Dark

Level 4

30% increased damage per Upgraded Skill used, resets upon using a non-Upgraded Skill

Level 10

Base Attack spins the Bestial Wheel to a random value

Level 20

Using an Upgraded Skill gives 1 AP to all other allies

Sidaro is an excellent choice for players aiming to directly boost Monoco's skill damage, as this weapon allows damage to increase throughout the entire fight without restrictions, provided players have active skills for each Mask type to use when needed. With this approach, by turn four, players can achieve a whopping 120% increased damage on any skill. Of course, this is easier said than done, as it requires a highly flexible build with strong AP management, which Pictos and Lumina can support. For players wondering about Upgraded versus non-Upgraded skills, this refers to using Agile Skills with the Agile Mask, for example.

Given its perks, Sidaro shines in scenarios against tough opponents, where battle is dragged on. While Sidaro has a lower Power output than many other Monoco weapons, resulting in weaker base damage, it offers a unique Might scaling to partially compensate, allowing players to significantly boost damage by heavily investing in Might. Last but not least, like many other Monoco weapons, Sidaro grants extra AP to other characters when adhering to the weapon's rules by using only Upgraded Skills, which can be invaluable during prolonged fights as well.

2 Brumaro

More Like a Magic Wand

  • Scaling: Vitality & Agility
  • Element: Physical

Level 4

Replay instantly when in Almighty Mask

Level 10

+3 AP when in Almighty Mask

Level 20

Once per battle, revive instantly with full Health if dead while in Almighty Mask

Brumaro is among the most unique weapons for Monoco, offering a combination of special life-saving and combat-enhancing perks not found elsewhere. Once again, players must tailor their skills to reliably reach the Almighty Mask, as once the Bestial Wheel lands there, nothing will stop Monoco.

Upon reaching Almighty, the battle Gestral gains an extra turn with three additional AP to cast any skill players desire. Additionally, Brumaro can revive Monoco with full Health, effectively granting an extra move to any ally who doesn't need to waste their turn reviving Monoco during tough encounters. While not as strong for raw damage builds, Brumaro is still an excellent choice for any creative Monoco builds players can devise.

1 Joyaro

Monoco Smash

  • Scaling: Defense & Agility
  • Element: Lightning

Level 4

Start battle in Almighty Mask

Level 10

20% increased damage for each consecutive turn without taking damage, stack up to 5 times

Level 20

Break damage is doubled while in Almighty Mask

While most of Monoco's weapons are designed to help players reach the Almighty Mask sooner, Joyaro simply bypasses all that, starting Monoco in Almighty with no strings attached. This alone makes it one of the best weapons for Monoco in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , but there's much more to it. Joyaro also boosts all of Monoco's damage by up to 100%, provided players have reliable strategies for avoiding damage, such as parrying, dodging, or using Shields from allies or Pictos.

Another compelling perk Joyaro offers is doubled Break damage during the Almighty state, which applies on the first turn. Here's a simple, viable strategy: equip AP and Break Luminas to Monoco and use the Portier Crash skill (cost 8 AP) right at the battle's start to destroy, break, or stun every enemy at once. For all these strengths, one might expect Joyaro to have lower damage compared to other options, but surprisingly, its Power is remarkably high. With all these benefits, it's hard to choose anything else once players get and upgrade Joyaro to wreak absolute havoc on enemies and bosses, as it's a joy to use.

10 Images
10 Images
